head.title: Bond Sale Schedule for the Week Ahead

hedline.hl1: Bond Sale Schedule for the Week Ahead
hedline.hl2: Bond Sale Schedule for the Week Ahead

block.p: This week's schedule of Treasury auctions includes the sale of new three- and six-month bills today and a four-week bill tomorrow. At the close of the New York cash market on Friday, the rate on the outstanding three-month bill was at 0.91 percent. The rate on the six-month issue at 0.98 percent, and the rate on the four-week issue at 0.90 percent.
The following tax-exempt fixed-income issues are scheduled for pricing this week:

This weekÂ’s schedule of Treasury auctions includes the sale of new three- and six-month bills today and a four-week bill tomorrow. At the close of the New York cash market on Friday, the rate on the outstanding three-month bill was at 0.91 percent. The rate on the six-month issue at 0.98 percent, and the rate on the four-week issue at 0.90 percent.

This week's schedule of Treasury auctions includes the sale of new three- and six-month bills today and a four-week bill tomorrow. At the close of the New York cash market on Friday, the rate on the outstanding three-month bill was at 0.91 percent. The rate on the six-month issue at 0.98 percent, and the rate on the four-week issue at 0.90 percent.
The following tax-exempt fixed-income issues are scheduled for pricing this week:
TAX EXEMPT
TOMORROW
Rochester, $54.6 million of general obligation bonds. Competitive.
Virginia Public Building Authority, $190.3 million of revenue bonds. Competitive.
TAX EXEMPT
WEDNESDAY
Georgia, $259.6 million of general obligation bonds. Competitive.
TAX EXEMPT
THURSDAY
Washington, $278.4 million of general obligation bonds. Competitive.
TAX EXEMPT
ONE DAY DURING THE WEEK
Albuquerque, $55 million of debt securities. Citigroup Global Markets.
California Department of Transportation, $675 million of debt securities. Citigroup Global Markets.
Penta Career Center, Ohio, $65 million of certificates of participation. Seasongood & Mayer, Cincinnati.
Harris County, Tex., $162.7 million of revenue bonds. UBS.
Harris County, Tex., $127.5 of debt securities. Ramirez and Company, New York.
Illinois, $150 million of building Illinois revenue bonds. Ramirez and Company, New York.
Indiana State Office Building Commission Facilities, $148.6 million of revenue refunding bonds. Morgan Stanley.
Irrigation District, Modesto, Calif., $50 million of debt securities. Bear, Stearns.
Kansas, $500 million of taxable pension obligation bonds. UBS.
Maricopa County Arizona Pollution Control Corporation, $144 million of pollution control revenue refunding bonds. Lehman Brothers.
Massachusetts Health and Education, $150 million of debt securities. Lehman Brothers.
Metropolitan Transportation Authority, $250 million of bonds. J.P. Morgan Securities.
New Jersey Health Care, $150 million of debt securities. Bear, Stearns.
New York City Municipal Water Finance Authority, $347.5 million of debt securities. UBS.
Oregon Department of Administrative Services, $250 million of debt securities. Bear, Stearns.
Salem-Keizer School District 24J, Oregon, $158.7 million of general obligation refunding bonds. Seattle-Northwest Securities.
The Trust For Cultural Resources of the City of New York, $61 million of revenue bonds for wildlife conservation society. Goldman, Sachs.
